name: Barbarian
description: Barbarians are mighty warriors who rage in battle, channeling primal fury into devastating attacks. They are tough, aggressive combatants who thrive in melee.

1.Rage: Enter a rage as a Bonus Action. While raging: Advantage on Strength checks/saves, +2 damage with Strength weapons, resistance to Bludgeoning/Piercing/Slashing damage. Lasts 1 minute. Number of rages: 2 at level 1, increases at higher levels.
1.Unarmored Defense: While not wearing armor, your AC equals 10 + Dexterity modifier + Constitution modifier. You can use a shield.

2.Danger Sense: Advantage on Dexterity saving throws against effects you can see while not Blinded, Deafened, or Incapacitated.
2.Reckless Attack: When you make your first attack on your turn, you can decide to attack recklessly. Doing so gives you Advantage on melee weapon attack rolls using Strength during this turn, but attack rolls against you have Advantage until your next turn.

3.Primal Knowledge: Gain proficiency in one skill: Animal Handling, Athletics, Intimidation, Nature, Perception, or Survival.

4.Ability Score Improvement: Increase one ability score by 2, or increase two ability scores by 1. You can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

5.Extra Attack: Attack twice, instead of once, when you take the Attack action on your turn.
5.Fast Movement: Your speed increases by 10 feet while you aren't wearing Heavy armor.

6.Subclass Feature: Gain a feature from your Primal Path subclass.

7.Feral Instinct: Advantage on Initiative rolls. If you are surprised and aren't Incapacitated, you can act normally on your first turn, but only if you enter your Rage before doing anything else.

8.Ability Score Improvement: Increase one ability score by 2, or increase two ability scores by 1.

9.Brutal Strike: When you use Reckless Attack, you can forgo Advantage on one attack to deal an extra 1d10 damage and apply one effect: Forceful Blow (push 15 feet, move up to half speed toward target) or Hamstring Blow (reduce target's Speed by 15 feet until start of your next turn).

10.Subclass Feature: Gain a feature from your Primal Path subclass.

11.Relentless Rage: If you drop to 0 HP while raging and don't die outright, make a DC 10 Constitution save. On success, drop to 1 HP instead. DC increases by 5 each time you use this feature (resets on Short/Long Rest).

12.Ability Score Improvement: Increase one ability score by 2, or increase two ability scores by 1.

14.Subclass Feature: Gain a feature from your Primal Path subclass.

15.Persistent Rage: Your Rage only ends early if you fall Unconscious or if you choose to end it.

16.Ability Score Improvement: Increase one ability score by 2, or increase two ability scores by 1.

17.Improved Brutal Strike: Brutal Strike damage increases to 3d10, and you can use two Brutal Strike effects when you use it.

18.Indomitable Might: If your total for a Strength check is less than your Strength score, you can use that score in place of the total.

19.Epic Boon: Gain an Epic Boon feat or another feat of your choice.

20.Primal Champion: Increase your Strength and Constitution scores by 4. Your maximum for those scores is now 24.
